Event:
Suicidal thoughts and self-harm

The main event in this passage is the speaker's suicidal thoughts and self-harm. The speaker had been feeling well for a year and two months, but then experienced a depressive episode that led them to think about killing themselves. They even went so far as to research lethal doses of medication and wrote a note to their loved ones before their cat intervened and made them realize what they were about to do. The event is unambiguously bad from the speaker's point of view, as it involves thoughts of harming oneself.
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in my own darkness, I can't help but wonder if the world would be better off without me. The voice in my head tells me I'm not good enough, that I'll never be good enough. And so, I find myself researching lethal doses of medication and writing a note to my loved ones. But then, my furry little savior, my cat, intervenes and makes me realize what I'm about to do. Maybe there's still hope for me. Maybe I can find a way to keep going, even when it feels like the whole world is against me." #suicideprevention #mentalhealthawareness #selfharm
